column4: leaf-sheep, llutz: I can hibernate on Windows (Fn+F1), if that's what you're asking. So I should make all 4 partition areas EXT2? Including /swap and the boot booster? I'm on a netbook (eee pc 1005ha, if that helps)
depends on your needs.. my netbook just has --->   (restore partition) (windows, ntfs) (linux ext4) (swap parittiion)
llutz: What do you mean by "depends on your needs"? I dont
what I NEED is not what you need.....   I find a single / prtition works just fine.
Okay, "/swap" for hibernation, should it be ext4 or "swap area"? Or another "use as"?
you dont understand how linux uses 'swap' - Linux uses a swap partition. its NOT ext2/3/4 its 'swap'
use it as swap. 4gb is a bit HUGE.....
i only use 512mb
Currently 1GB, but will be upgrading to 2GB in the near future.
then you proberly can make due with 2gb swap
ive had so many other issues with hibernate/suspend - i never use the feature any more
leaf-sheep, llutz: Okay, I'm not using hibernation. Seems much trouble than it's worth.Do I still need a /swap then?
use 512mb swap then  at least.
leaf-sheep, llutz: For the "Location for the new partition" do I select Beginning or End? Or does it not matter?
leaf-sheep, llutz: How much GB would you recommend /boot be? 1GB?
i dont bothe rwith its own /boot parittion
i use a partition for /, and perhaps one for /home and swap. thats it.
you DONT need a /boot partition.. it can put a /boot directory on the / parittion and work just fine
thats the big 'differance' a /boot partition  :) which in some cases is handy..
And would you recommend having a /boot? And how many GBs? 1?
i said you dont need a /boot partition.
and 100mb is plenty for most people.
let me repeate.. you most likely do NOT need a /boot partition.
